projects.title: Enterprise Internal Developer Platform
projects.description: Build a complete Internal Developer Platform using Backstage.io with service catalog, self-service infrastructure, and GitOps integration
projects.shortDescription: Complete IDP with Backstage, service catalog, and self-service infra
projects.fullDescription: Design and implement an enterprise-grade Internal Developer Platform that serves as the single pane of glass for 100+ engineers. Build a service catalog, integrate with Kubernetes for self-service deployments, implement GitOps workflows with ArgoCD, and create golden path templates for common use cases. This project demonstrates platform engineering at scale, developer experience optimization, and infrastructure automation.

implementationSteps.title: Backstage Setup & Architecture Design
implementationSteps.description: Install Backstage.io using the official CLI. Design the architecture: frontend (React), backend (Node.js), service catalog database (PostgreSQL). Set up authentication (OAuth2 with GitHub/GitLab/Okta). Plan the plugin ecosystem: Kubernetes, ArgoCD, Terraform Cloud, cost dashboards. Create a monorepo structure for custom plugins and software templates.

implementationSteps.title: Build Service Catalog & Component Registry
implementationSteps.description: Define catalog-info.yaml schema for microservices, libraries, and infrastructure components. Implement auto-discovery: scan Git repositories and automatically register services. Add metadata: ownership, documentation links, SLOs, dependencies. Create custom UI cards showing service health, deployments, and cost. Integrate with CI/CD to show build status and deployment history.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Self-Service Infrastructure
implementationSteps.description: Create Software Templates for common use cases: new microservice, database provisioning, Kubernetes namespace, CI/CD pipeline. Integrate Backstage Scaffolder with Terraform Cloud for infrastructure provisioning. Build approval workflows for high-cost resources. Implement RBAC to control who can provision what resources. Add cost estimation before provisioning.

implementationSteps.title: GitOps Integration with ArgoCD
implementationSteps.description: Install ArgoCD and integrate with Backstage using the ArgoCD plugin. Display deployment status, sync history, and health checks in Backstage UI. Implement GitOps workflow: service template generates Git PR, ArgoCD auto-syncs after merge. Create progressive delivery templates: canary deployments, blue-green deployments. Add rollback capabilities directly from Backstage.

implementationSteps.title: Observability & Platform Analytics
implementationSteps.description: Build custom dashboards showing platform adoption metrics: active users, service registrations, deployments per week. Integrate with Prometheus for infrastructure health metrics. Create SLO tracking: deployment frequency, lead time, MTTR. Add cost dashboards showing cloud spend by team/service. Implement feedback loops: user satisfaction surveys, feature requests.

implementationSteps.title: Production Readiness & Scale
implementationSteps.description: Implement high availability: load balancers, database replication, Redis for caching. Set up monitoring: application logs, performance metrics, error tracking (Sentry). Create runbooks and on-call procedures for platform incidents. Build onboarding documentation and video tutorials. Deploy to production on Kubernetes with proper security hardening (network policies, Pod security standards). Measure impact: developer productivity improvements, time saved per engineer.

projects.title: Enterprise SRE & Reliability Platform
projects.description: Build comprehensive SRE platform with SLO management, incident response automation, observability stack, and chaos engineering
projects.shortDescription: SRE platform with SLOs, incident management, observability, and chaos engineering
projects.fullDescription: Design and implement a complete Site Reliability Engineering platform that enables teams to achieve 99.99%+ availability. Build SLO/SLI dashboard, implement automated incident response with PagerDuty integration, deploy full observability stack (Prometheus, Grafana, Jaeger), and establish chaos engineering practices. This project showcases reliability engineering at scale, incident management leadership, and proactive reliability testing.

implementationSteps.title: SLO/SLI Framework Design
implementationSteps.description: Define SLIs for critical services: availability (uptime), latency (p50, p95, p99), error rate, saturation. Design SLOs with realistic targets (e.g., 99.9% uptime = 43 min downtime/month). Implement error budgets: calculate remaining budget, burn rate alerts. Build SLO dashboard in Grafana showing current status, burn rate, and error budget consumption. Create alerting rules when SLO is at risk.

implementationSteps.title: Deploy Complete Observability Stack
implementationSteps.description: Install Prometheus for metrics collection with service discovery for Kubernetes. Deploy Grafana with pre-built dashboards: RED metrics (Rate, Errors, Duration), resource utilization, business metrics. Set up Loki for log aggregation with LogQL queries. Deploy Jaeger for distributed tracing across microservices. Implement OpenTelemetry for unified instrumentation. Create correlation: link traces to logs to metrics.

implementationSteps.title: Incident Management Automation
implementationSteps.description: Integrate PagerDuty for on-call scheduling and escalation policies. Implement automated incident creation from Prometheus alerts. Build incident response runbooks in Markdown with automated actions (scale up pods, restart services). Create incident Slack bot for coordination: create war rooms, status updates, timeline tracking. Implement automated rollback for failed deployments.

implementationSteps.title: Blameless Postmortem System
implementationSteps.description: Create postmortem template: incident timeline, root cause analysis, action items. Build postmortem database: store all incidents, search by service/type, identify patterns. Implement automated postmortem generation: pull data from logs, traces, and Slack. Track action items: assign ownership, set deadlines, verify completion. Create monthly reliability review: trends, MTTR, repeat incidents.

implementationSteps.title: Chaos Engineering Implementation
implementationSteps.description: Install Litmus Chaos or Chaos Mesh on Kubernetes cluster. Design chaos experiments: pod failures, network latency, resource exhaustion. Implement Chaos Game Days: scheduled experiments with team observing. Create blast radius controls: start with dev/staging, gradually expand to production canaries. Build chaos dashboards: experiment results, system resilience scores. Establish learning culture: share findings, improve runbooks.

implementationSteps.title: Reliability Metrics & Continuous Improvement
implementationSteps.description: Build executive dashboard: MTBF (Mean Time Between Failures), MTTR (Mean Time To Recover), deployment frequency, change failure rate. Implement toil tracking: measure time spent on manual operations, prioritize automation. Create reliability scoring for services: SLO compliance, incident frequency, documentation quality. Set up automated reporting: weekly reliability reports, monthly reviews. Measure business impact: revenue protected, customer satisfaction improvements.

projects.title: Multi-Cloud Security & Compliance Platform
projects.description: Build enterprise security platform with Zero Trust architecture, DevSecOps pipeline, compliance automation, and security posture management across AWS, Azure, and GCP
projects.shortDescription: Enterprise security platform with Zero Trust, DevSecOps, and compliance automation
projects.fullDescription: Design and implement a comprehensive security platform for multi-cloud environments. Build Zero Trust architecture with service mesh, implement complete DevSecOps pipeline with SAST/DAST/SCA, automate compliance for SOC 2 and ISO 27001, and create security posture dashboards. This project demonstrates security leadership, regulatory compliance expertise, and building security-first infrastructure at enterprise scale.
learnings: Zero Trust Security Architecture with Istio
DevSecOps Pipeline (SAST, DAST, SCA, Container Scanning)
skillsYouLearn: Zero Trust Security Architecture with Istio
DevSecOps Pipeline (SAST, DAST, SCA, Container Scanning)

implementationSteps.title: Zero Trust Architecture with Service Mesh
implementationSteps.description: Install Istio service mesh on Kubernetes cluster. Implement mTLS for all service-to-service communication: automatic certificate generation and rotation. Define authorization policies: L7 policies based on JWT claims, service identity, HTTP methods. Implement request authentication: integrate with OAuth2/OIDC provider. Create security groups: isolate services by namespace, enforce network policies. Build observability: monitor denied requests, certificate expiry, policy violations.

implementationSteps.title: DevSecOps Pipeline Integration
implementationSteps.description: Implement SAST (Static Application Security Testing) with SonarQube: scan code for vulnerabilities, enforce quality gates. Add DAST (Dynamic Application Security Testing) with OWASP ZAP: automated security testing in staging. Integrate SCA (Software Composition Analysis) with Snyk: scan dependencies for known vulnerabilities. Add container scanning with Trivy or Clair: scan images before deployment. Implement secret scanning: prevent secrets in Git repos, rotate leaked secrets automatically.

implementationSteps.title: Secret Management at Scale
implementationSteps.description: Deploy HashiCorp Vault for centralized secret management. Implement dynamic secrets: database credentials generated on-demand with TTL. Set up Vault Agent for Kubernetes: auto-inject secrets into pods via annotations. Implement secret rotation: automated rotation of database credentials, API keys, certificates. Create audit logging: track all secret access, generate alerts for anomalous access. Build secret discovery: scan infrastructure for hardcoded secrets, migrate to Vault.

implementationSteps.title: Compliance Automation Framework
implementationSteps.description: Implement Infrastructure as Code scanning: check Terraform/CloudFormation for compliance violations before deployment. Create compliance policies with OPA (Open Policy Agent): enforce tagging standards, encryption requirements, RBAC rules. Build evidence collection automation: automatically generate SOC 2/ISO 27001 evidence (access logs, encryption status, backup verification). Implement continuous compliance monitoring: daily scans, automated remediation for drift. Create compliance dashboards: control coverage, open findings, remediation progress.

implementationSteps.title: Security Posture Management
implementationSteps.description: Deploy cloud security posture management (CSPM) tools: AWS Security Hub, Azure Security Center, GCP Security Command Center. Centralize findings: aggregate security alerts from all clouds into single dashboard. Implement automated response: auto-remediate common issues (open S3 buckets, missing encryption, excessive permissions). Create security scoring: rate services/teams on security posture, gamify improvements. Build threat detection: integrate with SIEM, create correlation rules, automated incident response.

implementationSteps.title: Identity Federation & Multi-Cloud Access
implementationSteps.description: Implement centralized identity provider (Okta, Azure AD, or Google Workspace) for all cloud access. Set up SAML/OIDC federation: single sign-on across AWS, Azure, GCP. Implement just-in-time access: temporary elevated privileges with approval workflow and auto-expiry. Create access reviews: quarterly reviews of all cloud permissions, automated deprovisioning. Build privileged access management: record all admin sessions, require MFA for sensitive operations. Measure success: mean time to provision access, access review compliance, security incidents reduced.
